January 7th, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I have just received both of your letters of January
4th, and I want you to know that I am grateful to you for
your comments.
You have expressed my personal view on "the Planning
Group" of the Kellogg Project, exactly. Dick took sharp
exception to Miles running away with the ball without con¬
sultation. I feel that the meeting on January 18th will
give you an opportunity to express your views, and I am
confident that your ideas will prevail.
i Insofar as the Herald Tribune series is concerned
^pr^the general operation of the Network* Dick Rider has
been invited to attend the Board meeting, and this will
give us an opportunity to lay out specific policies and
directives.
Cordially,
